revised_title: Thomas Henry Huxley's Influence on the Founding of Johns Hopkins University
tldr: This article discusses Thomas Henry Huxley's involvement in the founding of Johns Hopkins University in 1876. Huxley, a prominent English scientist and advocate for Darwinism, was approached by the university's first president, Daniel Coit Gilman, to give the inaugural address. Huxley's influence on the university's focus on research and graduate education, as well as his role in recommending faculty members, is highlighted in the article.
